data.title: Selection prompt to extract method not worked
data.body:
- VSCode Version:Version 1.1.0 (1.1.0)
- OS Version: Mac OS X EI Capitan

Steps to Reproduce:

2. I just can not do this, and I google a lot for this, then I got nothing, so I'm here.

data.title: Self-compiled version of VSCode fails to launch extension host on Arch Linux
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0-insider
- OS Version: Arch Linux (kernel 4.5.4-ck)

Hi,

I installed VSCode using [this PKGBUILD](https://github.com/fusion809/PKGBUILDs/visual-studio-code-oss/PKGBUILD) and while VSCode seems to be running fine, I have noticed that whenever I try to install extensions in the command pallette by typing `ext install ...` (where `...` is the extension's name) I get the result "No extensions found". To get some debugging information I ran `scripts/code.sh`, which returned (only including the last few lines of code as they are those that include an error):

``` bash
atever hasn't been checked yet
[22:51:17] [tsb] time: 24351ms mem: 659MB Δ621
*** Finished with 0 errors.
[22:51:19] Finished 'compile-client' after 30 s
[22:51:19] Starting 'compile'...
[22:51:19] Finished 'compile' after 7.43 μs
[14903:0512/225119:ERROR:browser_main_loop.cc(217)] Running without the SUID sandbox! See https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/docs/linux_suid_sandbox_development.md for more information on developing with the sandbox on.
[14903:0512/225123:INFO:CONSOLE(207)] "%c[Extension Host] %cdebugger listening on port 5870", source: file:////home/fusion809/GitHub/mine/PKGBUILDs/visual-studio-code-oss/src/vscode-1.1.0-insider/out/vs/workbench/services/thread/electron-browser/threadService.js (207)
```

the last line is what I think is most relevant to this extension issue. How do I fix it? Is there some command I should have run while building VSCode besides `scripts/npm.sh install` and `gulp vscode-linux-x64`. 

Thanks for your time,
Brenton

data.title: Snippet suggestion triggered incorrectly
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 1.1.0 (1.1.0)
- OS Version: Mac OS X Yosemite 10.10.5 (14F27)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a user snippet with a prefix "sup" 
   (I created mine in ~/Library/Application Support/Code/User/snippets/elixir.json)
2. In a file matching the language, type `S` or `s`, intellisense correctly suggests snippet "sup"
3. When proceeding to type non-matching characters, e.g. `erv` intellisense still suggests snippet "sup"

![screenshot 2016-05-12 13 26 23](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1111124/15213139/8d3877be-1845-11e6-97af-a6af439c1a7f.png)

Expected behavior:

When the typed characters no longer match the start of a snippet prefix, the snippet suggestion should not be shown.

data.title: "Extension host terminated unexpectedly" when opening C# file
data.body:
Whenever I open a C# file in VS Code, I get two error messages:

"Extension host terminated unexpectedly. Please reload the window to recover. [Reload Window]"
Followed by
"Error from the extension host: channel closed."

I'm using the CSharp extension (ms-vscode.csharp-0.3.7). Here's a screenshot:

https://imgur.com/8dGJuWK
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0
- OS Version: Windows 7 64 bits (fully patched)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install the C# extension
2. Open a C# file

Now the problem is, this issue happens only on one of my PCs (the one actually owned by my employer). The main differences with the other PCs I own are:
- It runs Win7 (I use Win 10 on my personal PCs)
- It has McAfee Antivirus (I use Win Defender on my PCs)
- It has MalwareBytes Anti-Malware (I use EMET on my PCs)

There are other differences of course, but these are the three biggest I can think of.

data.title: Update should reopen all last opened folders
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0
- OS Version: Windows

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Have more than one workspace folder open
2. Update to a new version

Observe: only on window is reopened. I would expect that all open folders get reopened.

data.title: SQL - Backslash at end of string disrupts syntax highlighting
data.body:
Could be related to #1520 / #1634 / #2830
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0
- OS Version: Windows 8.1 Pro

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create new/edit existing SQL file.
2. Enter a string with a backslash as the last character before the terminating single quote.
3. Syntax highlighting thinks the terminating quote is escaped.

SSMS does not behave like this, and will parse the same script without this issue.

Also reproduces when starting VSCode with the --disable-extensions command line argument.

Sample screenshot:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/460028/15210098/96e043b4-182c-11e6-9790-c10b2d5e4d06.png)
The select statement on line 4 shouldn't be that colour, since it is not part of the string.

The same snippet in SSMS:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/460028/15210149/d6180012-182c-11e6-9dba-c1144d6c1fb4.png)

data.title: Ctrl + Open Recent could open the folder in a new Window

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0
- OS Version: any

I constantly see myself doing the following two actions:
- new window
- then select a recently opened folder.

Would either be cool to have a special menu entry for this, make open recent configurable to create a new window or to support Ctrl + Open Recent which does both (my preferred solution)

data.title: Option to copy path with "/" forward slahes?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Any
- OS Version: Any

Feature suggestion:
Can we add into the config option where you can choose how path slashes will look like after copying.

Currently:
After Right click on file > Copy Path > Paste :

result will look like "c:\foo\bar\again.html"

It would be nice if we could choose option in config e.g:
workbench.action.copyPath.forwardSlash = true/false;
or 
editor.copyPathForwardSlash  = true/false;

so if editor.copyPathForwardSlash is set to "true" result would look like:
"c:/foo/bar/again.html"

data.title: code.cmd should wait for output before terminating
data.body:
Currently `code.cmd` does not wait for output before terminating like `code.sh`. Atom has the same issue in https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/4178

See https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/5941#issuecomment-218148072

data.title: Debug: continue action is broken when target app has multiple threads
data.body:
We are seeing this issue with CppTools extension and CSharp extension with VS Code 1.1.0 (stable). It doesn't repro in VS Code 1.0.0.

One repro involving CSharp extension is:
 Install VS Code 1.1.0
 Install .NET CLI tools and CSharp extension per instructions here: https://github.com/gregg-miskelly/omnisharp-vscode/blob/daily-build-docs/debugger.md
 Extract the attached project, do a "dotnet restore" on it
[clisample.zip](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/260455/clisample.zip)
Open the project folder in VS Code, put a bp in line 22
Start debugging
Hit the bp in line 22 multiple times until you have 2 threads running in the app
Remove the bp
Hit continue

The app continues but the VS Code UI thinks it is still in break mode.

data.title: [yaml] multiline strings improperly highlighted
data.body:

Paste this string


data.title: Middle mouse button scrolling

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10

I searched the issues but did not find any such post, so apologies if there is an existing thread that I missed.

I'd like to know if there is any middle mouse click scrolling, planned? That is, clicking the scroll wheel to toggle drag scrolling. It's a useful feature to have when navigating very long files.

And if it isn't, is there any API that would allow this to be enabled via an extension?

Thanks

data.title: Clicking on error message from debug console is not setting up pointer at line number all the time.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0-alpha
- OS Version: Windows10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch app and open folder for Basic Node js express project.
2. Start debugging and verify debug console.
3. Click on any error message showing up in the debug console to get exact line number.
4. Navigate to different error message and verify it should set the pointer correctly.

**Actual:** When navigating to different error message and going back and forth from one error message to other then mouse pointer is not setting up all the time.
**Expected:** When user navigate to different error message then mouse pointer should be set all the time at correct location.
![debugconsolepointersetissue1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/15200253/f132a944-1799-11e6-832c-5a026ba6ea87.gif)

data.title: Symbols not loaded for current project according to tsconfig.json lookup logic (only for first tsconfig.json found in project)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10
- OS Version: Windows 10

Symptom: 

VSCode only loads symbols for the first tsconfig.json it finds in the directory tree.  If you try to look up a symbol using Ctrl+T you will only see symbols from the first tsconfig.json in the project.

Expected results: 

When hitting Ctrl+T it should look at the current active file and find the next tsconfig.json up the directory tree and use that to load symbols.  Currently it seems that the syntax checker (compiler) uses the right logic to determine the correct symbols to load but Ctrl+T does not.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. clone this sample repo https://github.com/ashelley/vscode-tsconfig-all-symbols-test.git
2. Navigate to any project that is not the first project in the list (module3/Biz.ts)
3. Notice that symbols are loaded for only the first project:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3195045/15199261/8b188b04-1791-11e6-9bf6-471319d8402c.png)
1. Try to load a symbol from the current project.  Notice how the symbol loads for the syntax checker (compiler) (no errors) but does not load the symbol when hitting ctrl+T

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3195045/15199286/c17d4eb4-1791-11e6-86c5-72c6afea9eb7.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3195045/15199292/d5a4a9be-1791-11e6-9e70-79363600d24f.png)

data.title: The select stack frame lost focus after "Load more stack frames"
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1
- OS Version: Windows10, Ubuntu 14.04

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Select a stack frame and click "Load more stack frames"
2. The original selected frame will lose it's focus/highlight, it's hard to figure out which frame is currently selected

data.title: Load more stack frames shown on all threads
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1
- OS Version: Windows 10, Ubuntu 14.04

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a multithread application and start debugging
2. Enter break mode, For thread 1: debugger return 20 stack frames and total count of 100. For thread 2: debugger return 3 stack frames and total count of 3.
3. Verify the "Load More Stack Frames" frame is shown for thread1, Verify there is only 3 frames for thread 2
4. Click the "Load More Stack Frames" frame in thread 1

Problem:
Both thread 1 and thread 2 now shows the "Load More Stack Frames" frame, even though thread 2 only has 3 stack frames.

data.title: Debug Configuration drop down blank before creating launch.json
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0-alpha
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a folder with no launch.json config file
2. Switch to the debug viewlet

The drop down used to say "No Configuration" where now it says nothing until you create launch.json.

![noconfignotshowing](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12900364/15198132/6002cb2a-178a-11e6-933f-0aed7b6f301b.PNG)

Is this an intended change?

data.title: Please provide a code.ps1 alongside code.cmd and code in bin directory
data.body:
- VSCode Version:
  Version 1.1.0
  Commit c212f0908f3d29933317bbc3233568fbca7944b1
  Date 2016-05-09T12:53:58.929Z
  Shell 0.37.6
  Renderer 49.0.2623.75
  Node 5.10.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 Professional

not so much a bug as a feature request. I'd like to see a code.ps1 along with the code.cmd and code scripts.  Here's a skeleton to get started (blatantly copied from code.cmd and translated):

``` powershell
[CmdletBinding()]
    Param
    (
    [parameter(mandatory=$false, position=0, ValueFromRemainingArguments=$true)]$Remaining
    )

Remove-Item env:\VSCODE_DEV
$env:ATOM_SHELL_INTERNAL_RUN_AS_NODE=1
$dp0 = Split-Path -parent $PSCommandPath;
$exePath = [System.Io.Path]::Combine($dp0, "..\code.exe");
Write-Verbose "exePath is $exePath";
$jsPath =  [System.Io.Path]::Combine($dp0, "..\resources\app\out\cli.js");
Write-Verbose "jsPath is $jsPath";
Write-Verbose "remaining is $remaining"
Write-Verbose "command line is [$exePath] [$jsPath] [$remaining]"

&"$exePath" "$jsPath" $remaining

```

data.title: Auto closing single quote is wearing out my delete key
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0
- OS Version: Windows 7

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a rust source file and type `'`
2. Watch the editor add a second `'` even though there is almost zero chance you want one

I really want to turn this off, but I don't want to lose auto brackets. Please tell me there's some way to kill this, or that you'll put one in. :)

data.title: Multi-line strings are not handled properly for brace matching and code folding
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0
- OS Version: Win 8.1

Problem: Multi-line strings are not handled properly for brace matching and code folding.

Steps to Reproduce:

1) Open a JavaScript file and  put the following content in it:

```
var obj = {
    property: "line1\
line2\
line3\"
}
```

2) Place the cursor near the opening or closing brace to activate the brace matching.
3) Click the "minus sign" icon to fold the object declaration. Lines two and three of the object declaration remain visible.
